title: Confusion Management Strategies in Digital Learning Environments: Interactive Math Learning Design

context.prior_knowledge: Grasp of basic mathematical concepts and experience with digital devices
context.additional_context: In a blended environment utilizing personal devices (BYOD), learners study methods to recognize and manage confusion during mathematical problem-solving processes. Project-based assessments measure learning outcomes.

learning_goals: Learners can identify and explain three or more types of confusion signals that occur in digital environments.
Learners can apply two or more self-directed learning strategies in confusing situations using interactive tools.
Learners can complete a collaborative project that analyzes confusion factors through peer feedback and proposes improvement plans.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
